name: demi
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
half or partly: a demi-permanent hair colour Now 44, he is a drifting demi-celebrity. He knows he is not a handsome demigod.
More examplesFewer examplesI don't understand the logic of those demi-vegetarians who appear to eat salmon with a clear conscience. They see her as some sort of demigoddess.He is a gardener who can be trusted to transform four square feet of miserable concrete into a demi-paradise.If you prefer, you can replace semi- with either of the other prefixes meaning a half, demi- or hemi-.
